name: Chilli prawn linguine
instructions:
Mix the dressing ingredients in a small bowl and season with salt and pepper. Set aside.

Cook the pasta according to the packet instructions. Add the [INGREDIENT:fb951419:plural] for the last minute or so of cooking time.

Meanwhile, heat the oil in a wok or large frying pan, toss in the garlic and chilli and cook over a fairly gentle heat for about 30 seconds without letting the garlic brown. Tip in the prawns and cook over a high heat, stirring frequently, for about 3 minutes until they turn pink.

Add the tomatoes and cook, stirring occasionally, for 3 minutes until they just start to soften. Drain the pasta and sugar snaps well, then toss into the prawn mixture. Tear in the [INGREDIENT:ae68fe6c:plural], stir, and season with salt and pepper.

Serve with salad leaves drizzled with the [INGREDIENT:67c0ecaf:singular] dressing, and warm crusty [INGREDIENT:dba7b12a:singular].
